Looks like integration test failed. Not sure how these work. Any idea why?


I have enabled the API (again) in the Google Cloud Bigtable APIs dashboard. Not sure why this happened.

Thank you @wikier . This looks better

Jenkins is failing because tox is not installed: 

"[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.4.0:exec (setuptools-test) on project beam-sdks-python: Command execution failed. Cannot run program "tox" (in directory "/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/sdks/python"): error=2, No such file or directory -> [Help 1]"

Jenkins workers do not have tox package by default and it should be installed as part of the pom file. You may install to the user install directory using 'pip install tox --user'. If you know a better way of doing this with Maven please do so.

Hi Sergio,
I think I am basically in an LGTM state :-) Please one more thing besides the tests passing requirement -- The sync_version() function from setup.py. Rewriting code in setup.py is quote fragile. For instance it is not clear if it works at all for binary distributions for which apache_beam/**init**.py may not exist as a plain file. Better avoid this headache. I would be happier with having the XML parsing code (using regex) duplicated in a file (version.py or even **init**.py) and have a get_version() function. 

For the sake of making progress with this CL you can just leave a TODO in the setup.py that we want to move in this direction. Having a unified Maven based system is a very good achievement and I would rather not block this any longer.
Thanks!
Silviu

Sensible options here:
- Delete `equals` and `hashCode` -- these need not exist, I think.
- Rewrite equals to check relative rather than absolute values. Aka, `count1 == count2 && sum1 == 0.0 && sum2 == 0.0` or `abs(sum1 - sum2)/min(abs(sum1), abs(sum2)) < 0.0000001`
- Do nothing.

All three of these are probably better solutions than the current PR.

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
+1 to removing equals. It should only every be used in tests, if anywhere, and there it should be "equals up to error bound" in context like @robertwb says.
depends on https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/582 to get in first.

R: @dhalperi @swegner 
Not sure what the JIRA issue number is... also wasn't sure what to add for populateDisplayData other than the Table ID.
Thanks for the quick review. Will merge once the tests all finish.
@lucasallan -- thanks for picking this bug and all the other starter issues you fixed recently; excited to have your contributions! Hope you're willing to try again in this PR if interested.
@dhalperi yes, I'll pick this up again and I also have other issues in my queue to work on. Looking forward for more of your feedback.

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
R: @aaltay  [github tags in front, not after, user name]
[update: Per discussion this morning, JB is still working on watermarks.]

R: @lukecwik can you take a look?
CC: @vikkyrk FYI, moving Datastore both package and module
CC: @swegner FYI, removing DataflowDatastoreIO test. In general, the tests of Dataflow's translator should just test things in that module (e.g., an arbitrary BoundedSource/Reader) rather than specific IOs defined in other modules.
R: @robertwb , can you take a look ?

@silviulica thanks for the feedback. 

Summarizing, as I already replies to another comment from @aaltay, I need you to decide if in Beam you want:
1. Release all artifacts under a common version
2. Use different versions for each artifact

Because if you are more in the second scenario (e.g., the Python SDK will follow a different release cycle), it does make sense to keep the `pom.xml`-related code in the PR.

Added more comments. Please let me know if anything else needs to be updated.

Thanks.
BTW @aaltay, I think I'd prefer to have the `tox` installation in the CI configuration (as you have for Travis) rather than in the Maven build.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/5963153/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/5963153)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.
Looks like @amitsela will have to close this PR manually since the "closes #585" commit was merged into a branch, not master.
#585 is now merged into branch, maybe time for a rebase?

I was just wondering about it..
I'll close, thanks @lukecwik !

Thank you @wikier

I am fine with having tox in the CI configuration. Jenkins configuration configuration is not part of the source tree. @dhalperi may help you with setting that up. That said the disadvantage of not having it as a dependency in the maven build would be that our users (who wants to use maven) would need to install tox separately. (Having it installed in the Travis config is fine because, there is no user path for installing the sdk through Travis.)

This change is LGTM as longs as all tests become green (either by updating the Jenkins configuration or Maven build).

Display data implementation looks good. 

~~Would you mind adding an integration test in `runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java`, similar to [`DataflowBigQueryIOTest#testSinkPrimitiveDisplayData()`](https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/blob/master/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/test/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/io/DataflowBigQueryIOTest.java#L79)?~~ **[EDIT]** I chatted with @dhalperi who let me know that `DataflowRunner` doesn't have transform overrides for GCP IO other than Pubsub. Going forward we won't write these integration tests for transforms we don't override; no need to add it here.

@wikier - with respect to your question about versions we want #2. Eventually (long-term) we may be able to release in sync but right now Java and Python are in different stages (Java - much more advanced).

While my point of view on things is of a Spark (+YARN) cluster, I'm starting to get the feeling that there are a lot of interest in "out-of-the-box" packaging..

Let me raise that in the mailing list to get people's thought on this, and I might change the build to either compile or use profiles or something.

Dan, I would agree with your comment if Dataflow wasn't mucking with the translation in some way which may mean that there are some Dataflow specific tests:
"In general, the tests of Dataflow's translator should just test things in that module (e.g., an arbitrary BoundedSource/Reader) rather than specific IOs defined in other modules."

R: @dhalperi 

CC: @lukecwik, for context from Dan's DatastoreIO PR
CC: @tgroh @kennknowles: this is a case where we'd want capability matrix test opt-in
CC: @bjchambers @kennknowles: the need to propagate display data to leaf nodes is terrible; I can't wait until we have the new runner API and composite transform fidelity
R: @amitsela OR @aljoscha OR @dhalperi OR @jbonofre OR any committer, really.

I'd love to lift this up to the parent module, since it applies to both examples, but the way profiles are activated the Java 8 profile would turn it off and break the idea. But I hesitated to actually copy/paste it into the Java 7 examples module. And anyhow, the Java 7 examples have bigger issues, such as an actual compile-time dep on the Dataflow runner and also a cyclic dependency on the Spark runner until #539 is completed.

After #539, a trivial activation like JDK 1.4+ might be a way to have "active by default" that is not automatically deactivated.

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

Sergio, thank you so much for this PR. I had been overwhelmed by the idea of getting Python support in Maven, and have learned a lot from how you did it. Maven lifecycle is pretty cool!

Jenkins is still failing:

```
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Cannot run program "tox" (in directory "/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/sdks/python"): error=2, No such file or directory
    at java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:1048)
    at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:620)
    at org.apache.commons.exec.launcher.Java13CommandLauncher.exec(Java13CommandLauncher.java:61)
```

I added a comment in the `pom.xml` why this is happening, but I have to do some research to understand the best solution.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/5972911/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/5972911)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

@silviulica, in ebe4d0eef420c6feb8e3b1815d65d72a9e4a0487 I reverted back to the old way to manage the version. I kept the utilities implemented just in case they could be useful in the future, but they're not used anymore in the current code.

Thanks @dhalperi, I've been using this approach in some other projects, because I think is good to have all modules integrated in the main build. In 0a193fa3693bcfe1dfa49b7cd6cec349d7fe41a2 I switched to `virtualenv` for providing `tox`. But that doesn't make Jenkins happy, since `virtualenv` is not available either: 

```
[ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.4.0:exec (setup-test-virtualenv) on project beam-sdks-python: Command execution failed. Cannot run program "virtualenv" (in directory "/home/jenkins/jenkins-slave/workspace/beam_PreCommit_MavenVerify/sdks/python"): error=2, No such file or directory -> [Help 1]
org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.codehaus.mojo:exec-maven-plugin:1.4.0:exec (setup-test-virtualenv) on project beam-sdks-python: Command execution failed.
```

Unless anyone else has another idea, we have to get either `tox` or `virtualenv` installed in the ci boxes, otherwise the build would never work.

I think this needs a little more thought. Can we at least put each runner
in its own profile? Then hermetic builds can disable runners separately.
On Fri, Jul 8, 2016 at 01:27 Jean-Baptiste Onofré notifications@github.com
wrote:

> LGTM
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-beam/pull/609#issuecomment-231303816,
> or mute the thread
> https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe/AAgIT2KMbWsMifILy9BV6IxGkkpznn9_ks5qTgnWgaJpZM4JHrkf
> .

Can we not install virtualenv just as we were installing tox?

The key might be as simple as updating where python installs its `--user` packages to be inside the build dir (`target/`). Then we can put the absolute paths to `tox`/`virtualenv` in the `pom.xml` so that they will work on any machine. https://pip.readthedocs.io/en/latest/user_guide/#user-installs

I think we should try to keep optimizing for normal users even more than we are for Jenkins.

I agree with the spirit, @dhalperi, but actually have a different perspective: The runners are not real dependencies of these runner-agnostic Beam examples, but a hack for convenient interactive use of this maven module by users who are exploring. It isn't really about enabling/disabling runners.

So it is the build _without_ this new profile that is accurately configured. Hence there is a use case for surgically adding runners to the classpath (via the standard dependency mechanisms) but not for surgically removing them; the latter assumes a configuration that is somewhat erroneous by default.

It would actually be pretty ideal to have a profile activation that was specifically "interactive command line use" but I don't know if there is a clever way to make that happen.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/5974156/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/5974156)

Changes Unknown when pulling **2efe7617a595b8ac6167db40724d9874afd6df23 on francesperry:master** into *\* on apache:master**.

Hi Neville,

Ian had some in-flight changes to add streaming write support and display data, which were needed pre-0.9 as well. Would you mind re-basing this on master and making some minor fixups? This will have the advantage of restarting the jenkins build as well.

Additionally, there are a few places where Javadoc needs to be fixed up. At L126 there is still a reference to `ClusterId` (GitHub won't let me comment unless it's near a diff).

It would also be good if you could review users of the word cluster in all these files and see if they should be changed to instance.

Thanks!
Dan
